page.title: 01Kyle of Sutherland-Up Reach
page.content: This block includes an area north and south of th River Oykel which at this point is tidal and kown as the Kyle of Sutherland. The low lying land either side of the river is liable to flooding is used as rough grazing by crofters for cattle and sheep. The higher land on either side includes a small amount of decidious woodland and large forestry commission confier plantations together with heather moorland The road on the northern side of the river is the A837 main route to the West Coast from Bonar Bridge. on days when there is postal sevice the postal landowners provides public transport. Most of the dwellings are converted croft houses which on the south side are very scattered. A small community on the north side consists maily of retirement homes and few working crofts
